title: Scorched Sand
opening: Ephraim's sister is in danger Grado's General Caellach has attacked Jehanna Hall, forcing its surrender. Though Eirika and her troop have left the Hall, Grado's forces pursue them relentlessly. Trapped in the burning desert, enemy forces close in on them from all sides. With no time to wait for Frelia's troops, Ephraim leaves for Jehanna immediately. He must go to his sister's aid.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika, are you well?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: ...Oh...Seth?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Yes, it’s me. Please, you must rest. If we continue like this, you’ll...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No... it’s all right. We’re all suffering... We’re still completely surrounded by Grado’s armies... We may all die at any moment... I can’t lose focus now. Has anything changed?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Unfortunately, no. On every front, our forces meet with defeat upon defeat. Rausten’s knights are scattered and worn, and the enemy is closing in around them. And this accursed sand... Most of the units can’t get proper footing and are being slowed down. Mounted units are having the worst time, as their movement is severely limited. Princess Eirika... I ask that you leave for safety. We’ll use flying units and magic users to hold the foe here.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No. I will not retreat. If I give up now... My brother would not forgive me. I’m the princess of Renais. I will fight, either to victory or to death. Brother, I...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: There’s Jehanna Hall... It’s nothing but a ruin now. Blast! I don’t know what’s happened, but... I’d better get to Eirika and the others as soon as possible.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: I’ve discovered which of Grado’s generals lead the forces surrounding the hall. Valter the Moonstone and Caellach the Tiger Eye. Two of the strongest of the empire’s generals, with near-peerless forces. Above all else, we must rescue Princess Eirika, and yet... If you fall, Prince Ephraim, we’re all finished. And this accursed sand... Most of the units can’t get proper footing and are being slowed down. Mounted units are having the worst time, as their movement is severely limited. Some of us can move better than others, though... A combination of magic wielders and sky riders should give us some advantage. Whatever we do, we must move cautiously.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: I understand. This is just like the battle for Renvall. We either rescue Eirika or defeat all the enemy troops. If we accomplish either goal, victory is ours. Let’s move!

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Valter... You should stop playing around. If you don’t’ finish off Eirika’s forces swiftly... Her brother’s left the capital. He should be arriving here shortly. You don’t want to be fighting her still when he arrives. Trust me. We are equals here in Grado’s army. Would you like me to assist?

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: All you need to do is vanish, you disgusting old man. Eirika is mine. I won’t let you have her. She is so strong, so beautiful... She’s the prey I’ve dreamed of.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh... Your fangs are still sharp, eh? Good. Very good. Ah, Valter... You’re a beast. You’re bound to no country. You care nothing for friend or foe. Kill a man, claim a woman... You live for nothing more, you wretched beast. That’s your strength. That’s what makes you stronger than any many alive. A beast acts without remorse. Man’s morality cannot win. It’s nature’s way... The stage is all yours, Valter. Do not fail to get the girl’s bracelet. Our master demands it...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: The time is nigh, Eirika... Come to me!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: How goes it, Caellach?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Ah, Prince Lyon. Thank you, Your Highness, for gracing me with...your royal...er...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: You can stop. There’s no need for you to put on airs. You were made general for your military prowess, not your flowery speech.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: And an honor it is. You know, Prince Lyon, you’ve got a lot of nerve. You’re really worked over your dear friend the princess of Renais. Are you satisfied?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Is there some reason you ask?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: No, not really. I just wanted to see how you’d react. That’s all.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: She... Eirika has always been a very important person in my life. Both she and her brother have been friends of mine for a long time. Tell me, Caellach, do you have any friends to speak of?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Huh? Yeah, I got one. An old mercenary I fought with, went by the name of Joshua. He was a fool and a scoundrel, but now that he’s gone, I miss the lad. I don’t know where he’s at or what he’s doing, but...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Do you miss that life? Do you ever want to be a mercenary again, to see him?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Nope. The time we worked together was fun and all, but... No. I don’t want to end up another no-name mercenary lying dead in a ditch. I’d rather serve the Grado Empire and make a name for myself. I’m going to see how far my axe will take me. And then, one day...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: One day, you’ll kill me and be emperor in my stead. Is that it?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Uh... That’s...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: It’s all right. Think whatever you like if it helps you do your duty. As long as you do what I assign you to do, I’m happy. But for now, I’m going. You know what you need to do.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Yep, leave it to me. I am General Caellach, the Tiger Eye of the Grado Imperial Army, after all! Once my prey is within my reach, I never let it escape. Too bad for the princess, but they’ve no chance of winning. None at all.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: That building beyond the dunes is Jehanna Hall. I expect that’s where we’ll find Eirika and her companions. Duessel, Knoll. It’s time we rescued Eirika. I’ll need all your strength.

battle.speaker: Duessel
battle.line: Of course, Your Highness. I’ve pledged my service and my axe. You shall have both.

battle.speaker: Knoll
battle.line: Princess Eirika... She’s a friend of Prince Lyon’s, isn’t she? I’ll do what I can to help you. I feel like that is what Prince Lyon would want.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: The enemy’s numbers are great, but we do not need to face them alone. We must move quickly to join forces with Eirika and her company. I’m sure Seth and Innes will be there waiting for us. Let’s move!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Prince Innes... And Saleh. I’m sorry. I’m absolutely powerless here...

battle.speaker: Innes
battle.line: Eirika, you have nothing to apologize for. We’re not defeated yet. Jehanna Hall has fallen, that much is true. But if we can hold out until Ephraim arrives, we still have a chance of victory.

battle.speaker: Saleh
battle.line: And reports place Lady Myrrh at Prince Ephraim’s side. It is my duty to protect her. I will not die without having fulfilled my obligation to her.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: You’re right... I made a promise, too. I told Ephraim I would live to see him again. We just have to pull together. All of us. We just have to hold out a little longer. If we pool our strength now, I vow that we will all live to see our friends again.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: According to this ancient document... ...There was a huge battle here long, long ago. Every day, I’m out here digging up ancient weapons and artifacts out of the sand. There are still more to be found, of that you can be sure. It’s even said a long-dead sage left a copy of Metis’s Tome out here... Oh! But I won’t give that to anyone if I find it. Not a chance!

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: All the highest generals in Grado’s army receive titles named after gemstones. The emperor currently has six gemstones fighting in his service. Caellach, the Tiger Eye, commands the forces fighting here. The Moonstone, Valter, is taking part in this battle as well. Glen, also known as the Sunstone, died in the mountains of Carcino. Selena Fluorspar was killed in western Grado. Duessel, whom they call Obsidian, is missing in action... The Blood Beryl, whose real name is Riev, has also gone missing. Hm? How do I know all this? I know I may look young and naive, but this is my job. I’m here to pass this information along to help you out. And it’s good information, too, so don’t waste it.

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Jehanna Hall...has fallen. I wonder what’s become of Queen Ismaire. You there... Take this, and do some good with it.

battle-talk.speaker: Ephraim
battle-talk.line: Eirika!

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Brother? Is that really you? You’re not some phantom, are you?

battle-talk.speaker: Ephraim
battle-talk.line: No, it’s really me. Hold. Enemies approach.

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: ...Ephraim. Even when we were children, you were always there to protect me.

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: It’s been a long time, Ephraim.

battle-talk.speaker: Ephraim
battle-talk.line: Innes, is that you?

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: You arrived sooner than I’d expected. Eirika is safe. You’ve no need to worry.

battle-talk.speaker: Ephraim
battle-talk.line: I’ve heard that you’ve been watching over Eirika. I should like to offer you my gratitude.

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: It’s not necessary. Besides, there’s still a war to be won. We can’t rest easy till every last Grado soldier’s been defeated.

battle-talk.speaker: Ephraim
battle-talk.line: You’re right. Let’s go!

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: B-brother.

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: Tana? Why are you here? I told you to remain at Castle Frelia.

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: Don’t talk to me like that. I’m a fully sworn knight of Frelia, you know? I came all the way here with Prince Ephraim.

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: What? With that man?

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: Brother! Ephraim’s a good person. We can talk about this later. I still see enemy troops about. I think we should join forces and fight together.

battle-talk.speaker: Innes
battle-talk.line: Working together is, of course, the best strategy. But don’t do anything foolish, Tana. Who knows what Father would think.

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: I understand. You try not to be overly heroic yourself, Brother.

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: Oh, Eirika! Here you are!

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Tana! You’ve come as well?!

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: Yes, I came all the way with Ephraim. I’m just so happy to see you’re safe.

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Tana. Thank you so much for coming to my aid.

battle-talk.speaker: Tana
battle-talk.line: Well, of course I came. That’s natural. We’re friends after all!

battle-talk.speaker: Seth
battle-talk.line: Princess Eirika, are you well?

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Seth! If you’re here...

battle-talk.speaker: Seth
battle-talk.line: Prince Ephraim is safe as well. Princess Eirika, we will stop the remaining enemy soldiers here. Would you please take caution and think of your own safety?

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Seth. You’ve saved me so many times since the fall of Renais...

battle-talk.speaker: Seth
battle-talk.line: It is my duty. Let’s go, Princess Eirika.

battle-talk.speaker: Ewan
battle-talk.line: Ah! Teacher.

battle-talk.speaker: Saleh
battle-talk.line: Ewan? What are you doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Ewan
battle-talk.line: I came with Prince Ephraim and his friends. I’ve done a lot of good work, Teacher.

battle-talk.speaker: Saleh
battle-talk.line: Is that so... Well, if you all hadn’t shown up, I’m sure we’d be dead now. You’ve saved us, Ewan. Thank you. I am in your debt.

battle-talk.speaker: Ewan
battle-talk.line: Do you mean that? As a reward, will you teach me some more powerful magic?

battle-talk.speaker: Saleh
battle-talk.line: ...I suppose I should at that. But all in good time, Ewan.

battle-talk.speaker: Ewan
battle-talk.line: Yahoo!

boss.speaker: Caellach
boss.line: You’re a stepping-stone... And I’m moving up. Don’t take it personally.

boss.speaker: Caellach
boss.line: Bla-Blast... A bit more, and...a crown... would have been...mine...

boss.speaker: Valter
boss.line: I’ve no use for these bloodless minnows... Give me prey that will sate my bloodlust... I hunger!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Brother!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Eirika!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Oh, Ephraim... I’ve missed you so.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: And I’ve missed you. I can’t tell you how happy I am to see you safe. Oh, I almost forgot. I have something to give you.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: What are these?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: These are called Sacred Twins. We took these relics from Grado. The dark tome Gleipnir and the black axe Garm... I doubt either of us can use them, but... Why not see if one osf your companions can use them. They might have better luck.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: They’re from Grado? Does this mean Grado Keep has fallen?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Yes. I conquered the capital and defeated Emperor Vigarde. But still...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Eirika, may I make a suggestion? We’ve been able to join forces here so... How about if we all get together and trade information. There are people on both sides waiting after all.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Brother!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You’ve done well, Eirika.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Thanks to you, Ephraim. Ah... Wait a moment. I’ve something to give you.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: These are...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: These are the Sacred Twin relics of Jehanna. The ice sword Audhulma and the wind blade Excalibur.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Jehanna’s Sacred Twins? But it seems like we were too late... Jehanna Hall has fallen.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, and Queen Ismaire died resisting Grado.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Now that we have, at last, been reunited once again, perhaps this would be a good time to share information. I’m sure we all are most anxious to learn of what has happened.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I see unfamiliar faces among you here, so allow me to introduce myself. I am Ephraim, Eirika’s brother and crown prince of Renais.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: I’m Princess L’Arachel of Rausten. The pleasure is mine, of course.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I’ll begin by telling you of how we’ve fared in our mission. We seized the Grado capital and defeated her emperor, Vigarde. Grado’s capital guard have, to a man, surrendered and laid down their arms. Pockets of resistance remain, but the war itself is over.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Is that so?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: However, something remains that still bothers me. A Grado man named Knoll told me about something called a Dark Stone.?Their mages had uncovered lore that led them to craft a powerful magic stone. This Dark Stone may have been the catalyst of Grado’s transformation. It seems to be the source of that black wave of energy Myrrh described. Vigarde died some time ago, but the power of the stone played him like a puppet. The war and everything that passed since was planned by the Dark Stone’s master.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Well? Who is it?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...I still can’t believe it, but I’ll tell you nonetheless. According to Knoll, the man behind this is Lyon, the imperial prince. He said Lyon’s got the Dark Stone.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Figures it’s Prince Lyon...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No, that doesn’t make any sense. Ephraim and I know Lyon better than that. We’ve been friends for years. Lyon’s not the sort of person who could start a war like this.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: But, Eirika...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I saw Lyon recently. Ephraim, you might know this, but after I abandoned the sea route to Rausten, I traveled overland with Prince Innes to Jehanna. We ran into trouble with Grado’s forces, and I chanced upon Lyon. He didn’t share the details of his situation, but he intimated that he was on our side. Despite all appearances, he was on our side. So Lyon...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Eirika, I also met Lyon.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Did you really?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Yes. But, he was like a completely different person. To be honest, he didn’t seem to be completely...human.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Ephraim... What are you saying?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I’ll tell you what I saw. I found Lyon inside Grado Keep. This is what he told me: He said he was behind this war. He said he’d befriended us solely so that, one day, he could invade Renais... He told me he killed our father.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That... That can’t...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I know. I can’t believe it either. I refuse to believe it. How could he have planned all this since he was a child... I simply can’t fathom it. I’ve heard Lyon changed when he acquired the Dark Stone. I’ve no interest in magic, but... There was something uncanny about him. It seemed almost as though he were being controlled by something himself.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: The two of you might find this hard to accept, but... The state of Prince Lyon’s heart matters little. He has the Dark Stone. That rock is the cause of all that’s happened. The prince must be stopped.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Not yet. There is something that needs doing first.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: L’Arachel?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Prince Ephraim, I do believe you felt it as well. The Dark Stone held by Prince Lyon... It exudes a malefic miasma... We might be able to handle Prince Lyon alone, but that stone is beyond our ken.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Then what do you suggest?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: The Sacred Stones.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: The Sacred Stones?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: We’ve all heard the legend of the five Sacred Stones. They alone possessed the power to seal the Demon King away forever. So, of course, to dispel demonic magic, we must use the Sacred Stones!

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: You expect us to pin the outcome of this war on some fool legend?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...Not just the legend. We also have hope. According to Lyon, he has already seen to the destruction of Grado’s, Frelia’s, and Jehanna’s stones.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Hm. That explains something... Grado forces attacked me, intent on destroying the Stone of Renais. If that could be the reason they chose to invade Renais... The power of the Sacred Stones may be greater than we’d ever known.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Yes, exactly! If we acquire a Sacred Stone, we’ll be able to oppose the Dark Stone’s might!

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: But three of the stones have been shattered, and our options are few. Do you suppose that, during the invasion of Renais...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: No, I don’t think so. The Stone of Renais is hidden by the power of Eirika’s and my bracelets.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Grado has made many attempts to take our bracelets. Every one has failed, and so the stone may still be safe.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We have to confirm that, of course. We’ve defeated Grado, and we must turn our eyes to our homeland. It’s time to return to Renais.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Lady Myrrh.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Saleh...

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: I’m grateful to see you well. The people of Caer Pelyn will be overjoyed that you’re safe.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: I must apologize to you, Saleh. You were there to protect me from the very start of my journey. When we were attacked, I was separated from you, and... I’m so sorry to have worried you.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Lady Myrrh. As long as you are safe, we have nothing to be worried about. It will be my honor to serve you until your mission is complete.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Thank you, Saleh.
